description: Define workflow system goals, non-goals, and success criteria for MVP.
State the unit of execution as Envelope<TIn> → Envelope<TOut> transforms.
Commit to data-defined workflows executed by an interpreter (no runtime code generation).
Use inbound email processing as the MVP reference workflow for capability parity.
Include a node-in-pipe GUI designer in scope.
Provide and use consistent terminology: workflow definition, step, node type, action, publish, run, resume.
Explicitly constrain MVP to structured pipelines (no arbitrary DAG).
Implement Envelope with run metadata, payload, meta, vars, and optional error (v=1).
Persist env.meta.state to mirror legacy setState behavior.
Represent workflow definitions as structured pipeline AST per §3.2.
Support step types: NodeStep, IfBlock, ForEachBlock, TryCatchBlock, CallWorkflowBlock, ReturnStep.
Require unique Step.id across the entire workflow definition tree.
Enforce structured constraints: top-to-bottom execution within a pipe.
Disallow cycles except implicit iteration inside control.forEach.
Define and parse RetryPolicy shape on steps.
Define and parse OnErrorPolicy shape on steps.
Define Expr shape as {$expr: string} and validate it at publish time.
Define nodePath format for step addressing (string paths into nested tree).
Store workflow trigger metadata optionally on the definition.
Support CallWorkflowBlock inputMapping and outputMapping expressions.
Ensure all workflow JSON is serializable and stable for storage.
Version workflow definitions as immutable published versions.
Use Zod as canonical schema system for payloads, node configs, action I/O, and forms.
Provide SchemaRegistry to register Zod schemas by stable refs.
At publish time, load payloadSchemaRef and convert Zod→JSON Schema via zod-to-json-schema.
Store payload_schema_json alongside the published plan for GUI reflection and runtime tooling.
Validate workflow JSON structure against a WorkflowDefinition Zod schema during publish.
Validate every NodeStep.type exists in NodeTypeRegistry during publish.
Validate every action.call references an ActionRegistry entry (id + version) during publish.
Validate NodeStep.config using NodeType.configSchema during publish.
Compile/validate all expressions during publish.
At runtime, validate Action input with ActionDef.inputSchema before handler invocation.
At runtime, validate Action output with ActionDef.outputSchema before writing into payload.
Apply redaction rules before persisting envelope snapshots and invocation logs.
Expose JSON Schemas to GUI for payload, node configs, action I/O, and human task forms.
Ensure TypeScript types are derived via z.infer from the same Zod schemas.
Document the startup→publish→runtime validation pipeline.
Use a safe, deterministic expression engine with JSON-serializable outputs only.
Adopt JSONata as the MVP expression engine.
Restrict expression functions to an allowlist (helpers only).
Provide evaluation context: payload, vars, meta, error, helpers.
Enforce evaluation timeout (25ms) and max output size (256KB).
Disallow user-defined functions and any Node.js/global access.
Compile expressions at publish time and reject invalid syntax.
Surface expression syntax errors in GUI during editing.
Support expressions inside node configs, including nested objects (recursive resolution).
Document expression best practices (coalesce, null handling, array ops).
Implement components: API, Worker, Event routing, Scheduler, Registries.
Interpreter executes steps deterministically (same inputs ⇒ same results, ignoring time-based helpers).
Persist nodePath pointer after each completed step for crash-safe resume.
Implement run statuses: RUNNING, WAITING, SUCCEEDED, FAILED, CANCELED.
Insert workflow_run_steps STARTED record before step execution.
Update workflow_run_steps to SUCCEEDED with duration_ms and attempt count on success.
On retryable failure, schedule a retry wait instead of sleeping inside worker.
On non-retryable failure, bubble to nearest enclosing tryCatch; fail run if none.
Implement control.if: evaluate condition (Expr) and execute then/else pipe.
Treat control.if evaluation failures as ExpressionError.
Implement control.forEach iteration over items Expr; set vars[itemVar] per iteration.
Restore previous vars[itemVar] after forEach finishes.
Support forEach concurrency default=1; ignore or cap >1 in MVP if needed.
Implement per-item error behavior (continue vs fail) for forEach.
Implement control.tryCatch to catch errors from nested steps and execute catch pipe.
Support captureErrorAs to copy env.error into env.vars[captureErrorAs].
Implement control.return to terminate a run immediately.
Implement a run lease mechanism to prevent double execution across workers.
Store lease_owner and lease_expires_at on workflow_runs.
Scheduler reclaims stale leases and re-queues runs safely.
Define error category codes: ValidationError, ExpressionError, TransientError, ActionError, TimeoutError.
Implement RetryPolicy backoff with multiplier and jitter.
Implement retry scheduling via workflow_run_waits (wait_type='retry').
Enforce idempotency requirement for side-effect actions.
Create unique constraint for (action_id, action_version, idempotency_key).
On duplicate idempotency key, return stored output without calling handler.
Treat STARTED invocation with stale lease as retryable TransientError.
Implement event.wait node that registers wait_type='event' and parks run.
event.wait uses correlationKey Expr to compute wait key.
event.wait supports timeoutMs mapped to wait.timeout_at.
Implement POST /workflow/events to insert workflow_events and resume one matching run atomically.
On event resume, apply config.assign mappings to payload/vars as specified by node config.
Implement human.task wait pattern for manual interventions (record + wait + validate output).
Mark timeout resumes as TimeoutError and route through tryCatch if present.
Persist sanitized envelope snapshot per checkpoint and cap size/retention.
Include tenant_id (if available) in log context for every step.
Persist action invocation logs (sanitized input/output) for run viewer debugging.
Support onError=continue to record an error and continue to next step.
Support onError=fail to stop execution (or enter enclosing catch).
Implement redaction rules as JSON pointers; always mask secretRef fields.
Expose run history: steps, attempts, errors, and snapshots for GUI run viewer.
Support canceling runs and marking status CANCELED.
Support admin resume endpoint for WAITING runs with audit logging.
Ensure all persisted snapshots are JSON-serializable (no functions, Dates).
Ensure helper nowIso() is the only time-based helper enabled by default.
Implement max snapshot size enforcement with truncation markers.
Implement payload redaction before writing workflow_action_invocations.input_json/output_json.
Validate action.call args after expression resolution against action input schema.
Support action.call saveAs to store validated action outputs at a payload path.
Ensure transform.assign updates are atomic for a step (all-or-nothing).
Ensure transform.assign rejects writes to unknown or disallowed payload paths at publish time (best-effort).
Persist publish-time payload_schema_json for GUI field picking.
Persist who published a workflow version and when (audit fields).
Provide default retry policies per node/action if step.retry omitted.
Implement SchemaRegistry register/get/toJsonSchema methods.
SchemaRegistry keys are stable refs (e.g., payload.EmailWorkflowPayload.v1).
Implement ActionRegistry keyed by (id, version).
ActionRegistry returns action metadata for GUI discovery (label/category/description/icon).
ActionRegistry stores sideEffectful flag and retryHint.
ActionRegistry stores idempotency strategy (engineProvided/actionProvided).
Implement NodeTypeRegistry keyed by nodeType id.
NodeTypeRegistry stores configSchema (Zod) and handler function.
NodeTypeRegistry stores UI metadata for palette and config panel forms.
Registries are initialized at service startup and immutable during process lifetime in MVP.
Registry discovery endpoint returns JSON Schemas (converted) for UI form generation.
Registry discovery endpoint returns examples/snippets where available.
NodeTypeRegistry includes structural nodes and domain nodes for email workflow.
SchemaRegistry is used during publish to validate payloadSchemaRef existence.
Registries have unit tests covering lookups and schema conversions.
Implement NodeType state.set with config {state:string}.
Implement NodeType event.wait with config (eventName, correlationKey Expr, timeoutMs, assign).
Implement NodeType transform.assign with config assign map[path]=Expr.
Implement NodeType action.call with config (actionId, version, args, saveAs, onError, idempotencyKey).
Implement NodeType email.parseBody with legacy-parity fallback behavior.
Implement NodeType email.renderCommentBlocks with HTML->blocks conversion fallback.
Implement control.if, control.forEach, control.tryCatch, control.return as interpreter-managed blocks.
Register Action parse_email_reply with Zod input/output schemas.
Register Action find_ticket_by_reply_token with Zod input/output schemas.
Register Action find_ticket_by_email_thread with Zod input/output schemas.
Register Action convert_html_to_blocks with Zod input/output schemas.
Register Action create_comment_from_email with Zod I/O + idempotency.
Register Action process_email_attachment with Zod I/O + idempotency.
Register Action find_contact_by_email with Zod input/output schemas.
Register Action resolve_inbound_ticket_defaults with Zod input/output schemas.
Register Action create_ticket_from_email with Zod I/O + idempotency.
Register Action create_human_task_for_email_processing_failure with Zod input/output schemas.
Register Action send_ticket_acknowledgement_email (stub) and set onError=continue at call sites.
Document recommended idempotency keys for email workflow actions.
Provide Zod config schemas for node types per Appendix B.1.
Define EmailWorkflowPayload Zod schema and register as payload.EmailWorkflowPayload.v1.
Include fields: emailData, providerId, tenantId, processedAt, parsedEmail, existingTicket, matchedClient, ticketDefaults, targetTicketId.
Workflow is triggered by INBOUND_EMAIL_RECEIVED event (no start wait step required).
Extract and store emailData/providerId/tenantId/processedAt from event payload.
Parse and sanitize email body via email.parseBody node; store confidence and metadata.
Resolve existing ticket via reply token when present.
Fallback to threading header lookup when reply token not matched.
If existing ticket: create comment (author_type=contact) with parsed content.
If existing ticket: process attachments with per-item error continue behavior.
Return early after handling reply path.
If new email: attempt exact contact match by sender email and store matchedClient if found.
Resolve inbound ticket defaults by tenantId+providerId; if missing, set ERROR_NO_TICKET_DEFAULTS and return.
Compute final client/contact/location rules with the same override behavior as legacy code.
Create ticket and store ticket_id into payload.targetTicketId.
Process new-ticket attachments with per-item error continue behavior.
Create initial comment (author_type=internal) using sanitized HTML/text fallback.
Set EMAIL_PROCESSED state on success.
Optionally invoke ack action when matchedClient exists; do not fail workflow if it errors.
Outer catch sets ERROR_PROCESSING_EMAIL and AWAITING_MANUAL_RESOLUTION.
Outer catch creates human task for manual intervention with sufficient context.
Render workflows as a vertical node-in-pipe canvas with step cards (top-to-bottom).
Render control.if blocks with THEN and ELSE nested pipes.
Render control.tryCatch blocks with TRY and CATCH nested pipes.
Render control.forEach blocks with BODY nested pipe and itemVar/concurrency display.
Provide node palette with search powered by NodeType registry discovery.
Support drag/drop reorder within a pipe and move between nested pipes.
Open a right-side config panel when a step is selected.
Generate config forms from node config JSON Schema and validate required fields.
Provide expression editor for Expr fields with field picker insertion.
Field picker browses payload schema and vars/error/meta trees.
Validate expressions locally (syntax) and display errors inline.
Publish button triggers server-side validation and blocks publish on severity=error.
Highlight publish validation errors by stepPath and show breadcrumb to nested location.
Provide run list view with status filters and timestamps.
Provide run details view with step timeline, attempts, and errors.
Show sanitized envelope snapshots and action invocation logs per step.
Provide admin resume/cancel UI actions where permitted.
Ensure all displayed sensitive fields are redacted/masked per rules.
Implement workflow definition CRUD endpoints (list/get/create/update).
Implement publish endpoint returning {ok,publishedVersion,errors} per Appendix A.
Implement start run endpoint that creates workflow_runs record and initial nodePath.
Implement get run endpoint returning status + nodePath + timestamps.
Implement list run steps endpoint returning workflow_run_steps entries and links to snapshots.
Implement cancel run endpoint to mark CANCELED and release any waits/leases.
Implement resume run endpoint for admins to resume WAITING runs (audited).
Implement node registry endpoint returning node defs + config schemas + UI metadata.
Implement action registry endpoint returning action defs + I/O schemas + UI metadata.
Implement schema endpoint returning JSON Schema for payload/form schemas.
Implement event submit endpoint to route events to waits atomically.
Implement admin event list endpoint for debugging.
Register legacy action implementations with schemas in the new ActionRegistry.
Recreate email workflow as data and validate behavioral parity in a canary tenant.
Run both systems in parallel to compare outcomes and side effects.
Switch routing to the new runtime only after parity and idempotency checks.
Create unit tests for expression engine sandboxing and helper allowlist.
Create integration tests for waits/resume/timeouts and retry scheduling.
Create integration tests for tryCatch/forEach semantics and idempotency caching.
Create E2E tests for the email workflow (new ticket + reply path + attachments).
Define stable publish error codes (e.g., UNKNOWN_NODE_TYPE, UNKNOWN_ACTION, INVALID_CONFIG, INVALID_EXPR).
Publish validator must include stepPath and message for every error and warning.
Implement node type table (ID → config fields → behavior) as the contract for implementers.
Implement Zod pseudo-config schemas in Appendix B.1 as real Zod schemas in code.
Implement ActionDef template fields and enforce required fields at registry registration time.
Implement recommended email idempotency key patterns for create_ticket, create_comment, and attachment processing.
